text: Dheeran Chinnamalai Gounder Peravai leader Yuvaraj appeared before the Coimbatore TANPID court that is hearing a case related to his alleged involvement in an emu farm case. The Erode Economic Offences Wing Police had registered a case in 2012 against five persons including Yuvaraj that they swindled Rs. 2.70 crore investors’ money after promising lucrative returns. The police had arrested Yuvaraj but he came out on bail. Meanwhile, the Namakkal Police arrested him for his alleged involvement in the murder of Dalit youth Gokulraj and he was in the Vellore prison. Following a TANPID court direction, the police produced him before the court, which then posted the hearing for March 21.
title: Yuvaraj appears in city court
